An apartment building has received significant damage in Ternopil.
At least 9 civilians have been killed and 40 others wounded in Ternopil.
A short time ago, two MiG-31K fighters launched two Kinzhal aeroballistic missiles at Ternopil. They impacted outside the city limits.
There is an increased threat of additional Kinzhal strikes for the next 24 hours.
At least 9 civilians have been killed and 40 others wounded in Ternopil.

The civilian death toll in Ternopil has risen to 26, three of which are children. 
92 others have been injured, and there are still 26 people missing under the rubble.
Clear footage showing a Kh-101 cruise missile releasing flares as a countermeasure, before it impacts a residential building in Ternopil.
Clear footage showing a Kh-101 cruise missile releasing flares as a countermeasure, before it impacts a residential building in Ternopil.
Before and after of the building on the right being hit.
Before and after of the building on the right being hit.
7 Kh-101 cruise missiles striking a radio equipment factory in Ternopil.

Fighting has once again broken out between STG government forces and the SDF near the town of Ghanem Ali, east of Raqqa.
The SDF carried out strikes on ISIS-affiliated FPV drone operators reportedly working for the STG in the surrounding desert, which resulted in clashes subsequently resuming on the frontline east of Ghanem Ali. Earlier fighting also took place in this same area from Saturday through to Monday.

Fighting has once again broken out between STG government forces and the SDF near the town of Ghanem Ali, east of Raqqa.
The SDF carried out strikes on ISIS-affiliated FPV drone operators reportedly working for the STG in the surrounding desert, which resulted in clashes subsequently resuming on the frontline east of Ghanem Ali. Earlier fighting also took place in this same area from Saturday through to Monday.

Typical 2025 Ukrainian trench system: completely covered by even 2 meters of dirt, leaving only firing positions and entry/exit sticking out uncovered (anti-drone grates can be added to firing positions but are not always present).
This trench in particular was dug behind a natural obstacle, in this case the Yanchur river, and a barbed wire line was added right after the river later on.
This trench, while not completely camouflaged despite the similar color of the covering and surrounding dirt, is very sturdy and requires dozens and dozens of FPV strikes to even blast a small hole through, multiple direct artillery strikes or a direct FAB hit. Unfortunately for Ukraine, these trenches were and are mostly left undefended to Russian forces because of the lack of infantry to man them, and the Russians gladly accept them as mid-way accumulation points for further offensive operations, as if they were artificial settlements/basements.
Once again, I want to stress that even this way of building is not perfect, and would be only in the case of complete camouflage of the trench system inside a treeline or forest area. Camouflage is everything for a position: if you're found, you're automatically a target and you will, eventually, be destroyed.
If you're never found, you can't become a target in the first place, and even ambush attacking infantry under the right conditions. 
The same video offers even more information: it shows a failed Russian flagging operation. Once again, I advise caution while mapping Russian or Ukrainian advancements by using flags: everything that moves in the battlefield is struck, and even the primary task itself of the flaggers is to record a video and retreat, and not to occupy a new position and definitely not to consolidate it.
Geolocation: 
https://x.com/ukrliberation/status/1990498077749465495
Source video: 
t.me/svarog_usf/551
Coordinates: 
47.84848, 36.30634

Construction of anti-drone nets continues along the remaining logistical routes used by Ukrainian forces in Donetsk Oblast.
Construction of anti-drone nets continues along the remaining logistical routes used by Ukrainian forces in Donetsk Oblast.

Ukrainian forces have recaptured the village of Danylivka, Hulyaipole direction, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~355.
Total land area: ~0.97 km¬≤.
The Hulyaipole - Pokrovsk'e road is now unblocked, but is still very dangerous to move along.

Russian forces have captured the village of Zatyshshya, Hulyaipole direction, Zaporizhzhia Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~43.
Total land area: ~0.59 km¬≤.

Russian forces have captured the town of Yampil, Lyman direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~2,150.
Total land area: ~5.37 km¬≤.

 NEW:
 U.S. AFRICOM has attacked Somalia 
97 times
 this year, setting a new record for the highest number of strikes on the country in a single year
The strikes, which are framed as attacks on ISIS-Somalia and Al-Shabaab, have not been without civilian casualties.
American strikes three days ago led to the deaths of at least 12 civilians, including 8 children.
Somali sources report that grieving families are pressured by authorities to remain silent about the civilians killed by the United States and the U.S.-backed 'Danab Brigade.'
@Middle_East_Spectator
Explosions in Slovyansk, Donetsk Oblast. Russian KAB glide-bombs are striking the city. More have been launched.

In the Hulyaipole direction, Russian forces continued to advance towards Hulyaipole from the northeast, making additional significant progress in several different areas.
In the southeast, Russian advances behind Vesele forced the remaining Ukrainian formations stationed in and around the village to withdraw to Zelenyi Hai. Russian forces subsequently took full control over Vesele, and advanced down the treelines to the west.
To the west, Russian forces bypassed the village of Zatyshshya from the east, entrenching north of the Kalmychka River. They then crossed the river to the south, capturing treeline positions on the opposite tactical heights, while other forces began pushing to the southwest. The Russians then secured the rest of the positions north of Zatyshshya, began pushing to the northwest of the village, and captured its northern street. Assault groups from the southern bank of the Kalmychka River then entered the southern street of the village from the east, quickly establishing control over it and a section of the road to the south.
To the northwest, Russian forces made additional progress along the tactical heights northeast of Hulyaipole, fleshing out the spearhead towards Varvarivka. They secured the agricultural buildings northwest of Zatyshshya and the treelines to the north, before crossing the Velyka Novosilka - Hulyaipole Road, and entering three parallel treelines to the west. Other assault groups secured the rest of the positions north of the gulley west of Yablukove, and advanced southwest and uphill to the other treelines west of the Velyka Novosilka - Hulyaipole Road. 
To the north, Russian forces continued taking positions in the direction of the Hulyaipole - Pokrovsk'e Road and captured new positions in three separate treelines north of the initial breakthrough to the reservoirs. Meanwhile, DRGs penetrated further west, and came within 500 metres of the Hulyaipole - Pokrovsk'e Road and the village of Varvarivka.
+ ~24.07 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
Military Situation In Ukraine On November 19, 2025 (Maps Update)
Military Situation In Ukraine On November 19, 2025 (Maps Update)

Harsh Mobilization in Ukraine: From Running Down Civilians to Conscripting the Homeless
Ukraine is facing a complex set of profound challenges: the collapse of the energy system, corruption allegations reaching the highest echelons of power, and a growing number of desertions amidst advances by Russian troops. A critical shortage of infantry is compelling the authorities to find ways to replenish the ranks of the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU), leading to a tightening of measures by the Territorial Centres for Recruitment and Social Support (TRC). The methods used in mobilization are becoming increasingly aggressive and are causing public outcry.
A stark illustration of the situation is a video from the village of Kyselivka in the Kherson region, where TRC staff, driving a Toyota Land Cruiser, hit a male cyclist who was riding with a child. As a result of the incident, the man died at the scene, and the child died on the way to the hospital. This case, however, is not an isolated one. 
üëâ
